item.description: <p>The Economic Regulation Authority investigation found more than $4 million in overpaid bills since February 2023.</p>

item.title: Suicide bomber targets Islamabad court, killing 12 people and wounding 27, minister says
item.description: <p>Witnesses described scenes of mayhem in the immediate aftermath of the explosion, which was heard more than a kilometre away.</p>

item.title: Australian activewear label Exotic Athletica folds after 10 years
item.description: <p>After &quot;10 wild, messy, fabulous years&quot;, the &quot;much-loved&quot; brand is disappearing for good.</p>

item.title: Missing dog reappears after seven weeks in South Australian scrub
item.description: <p>A missing Maltese cross named Einstein, who took off in South Australia from his holidaying Queensland owners several weeks ago, has turned up alive.</p>

item.title: UK government is caught up in a feud between Trump and the BBC
item.description: <p>The UK&#x27;s government is due to weigh in on a feud between the BBC and Trump, who is threatening to sue the broadcaster for $US1 billion ($1.5 billion) over the way it edited a speech he made.</p>

item.title: 'We don't want a cotton wool society': Why Queensland's top paediatric surgeon gives e-bikes the green light
item.description: <p>Professor Roy Kimble said he&#x27;d much rather see kids riding safely on legal e-bikes than being chauffeured around by mum and dad.</p>

item.title: 'Drop crocs': Evidence of ancient crocodiles that climbed trees found in rural Queensland
item.description: <p>&quot;﻿They were perhaps hunting like leopards, dropping out of trees on any unsuspecting thing they fancied for dinner.&quot;</p>

item.title: Today in History - November 12: Dramatic overestimation in how much dynamite is needed to blow up a whale
item.description: <p>Eager to clear a popular beach in the US of a beached sperm whale, local authorities hatched upon a dramatic solution on November 12, 1970.</p>

item.title: Australia Post's urgent Christmas scam warning
item.description: <p>U﻿nscrupulous grifters are ramping up their efforts to target Australians in the lead-up to the festive season.</p>

item.title: Tractor among nine vehicles stolen from Victorian farm
item.description: <p>T﻿he thieves stole $150,000 worth of items including a ute, a lawn mower, paintings, and a wine fridge.</p>

item.title: Liberal party to thrash out united stance on net zero target
item.description: <p>L﻿eader Sussan Ley will today attempt to heal energy policy tensions at a crucial meeting of MPs. </p>

item.title: UK halts intelligence sharing with US over drug boat attacks
item.description: <p>S﻿ources said the UK was concered about the legality of the missile strikes, and did not want to be complicit.</p>

item.title: Russia fights for land back or compo in High Court feud
item.description: <p>The High Court will decide whether the Australian government&#x27;s cancellation of a lease for a new Russian embassy was legal on national security grounds.</p>

item.title: Money troubles push more and more Aussies into side hustles
item.description: <p>B﻿ut an executive at one of the big four banks says these gigs and micro-businesses should not be underestimated.</p>

item.title: Oscar-nominated star Sally Kirkland dies aged 84
item.description: <p>T﻿he actress has been remembered as &quot;funny, feisty, vulnerable and self deprecating&quot; amid other tributes.</p>
